docs.lead_paragraph: A Michigan woman was charged with murder on Wednesday in the death of her newborn son, who police say was left neglected in a garage after she gave birth in December and whose body was found weeks later in a recycling center.

headline.main: Michigan Woman Charged With Death of Newborn Found at Recycling Center
headline.print_headline: Michigan Woman Charged With Death of Newborn Found at Recycling Center

docs.snippet: A Michigan woman was charged with murder on Wednesday in the death of her newborn son, who police say was left neglected in a garage after she gave birth in December and whose body was found weeks later in a recycling center.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Democratic congressman who is weighing a U.S. Senate run in politically divided Ohio has publicly switched his position to supporting abortion rights, saying Wednesday the decision is deeply personal and unrelated to any political aspirations.

headline.main: Democratic US Rep. Ryan Says He Now Supports Abortion Rights
headline.print_headline: Democratic US Rep. Ryan Says He Now Supports Abortion Rights

docs.snippet: A Democratic congressman who is weighing a U.S. Senate run in politically divided Ohio has publicly switched his position to supporting abortion rights, saying Wednesday the decision is deeply personal and unrelated to any political aspirations.

docs.lead_paragraph: Illinois police have arrested a couple wanted for abducting their two children in 2006 after losing custody of them while authorities in Las Vegas investigated accusations the mother abused drugs while pregnant, police said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Illinois Police Arrest Couple Wanted for Abducting Their Children in 2006
headline.print_headline: Illinois Police Arrest Couple Wanted for Abducting Their Children in 2006

docs.snippet: Illinois police have arrested a couple wanted for abducting their two children in 2006 after losing custody of them while authorities in Las Vegas investigated accusations the mother abused drugs while pregnant, police said on Wednesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: A New Jersey woman accused of dousing her newborn daughter with accelerant, setting her on fire and leaving her in the middle of a road repeatedly said "I'm sorry" as a man held her down, according to audiotape of a chaotic 911 call.

headline.main: 911 Calls: Mom Apologized After Allegedly Setting Baby Afire
headline.print_headline: 911 Calls: Mom Apologized After Allegedly Setting Baby Afire

docs.snippet: A New Jersey woman accused of dousing her newborn daughter with accelerant, setting her on fire and leaving her in the middle of a road repeatedly said "I'm sorry" as a man held her down, according to audiotape of a chaotic 911 call.

headline.main: Changing Early Pregnancy Etiquette: Share Good News, and Bad

docs.abstract: When we decided not to tell friends and family about my pregnancy until after the first trimester, we never paused to consider how much we might need those people if something did actually go wrong.
docs.snippet: When we decided not to tell friends and family about my pregnancy until after the first trimester, we never paused to consider how much we might need those people if something did actually go wrong.

docs.lead_paragraph: The G.O.P. should help all parents, not just its own.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by author Jennifer Senior observes that Republicans in Congress are far more generous with giving out parental leave to their staffers than their stance on issue for workforce at large suggests; notes that Republicans say government should not require employers to offer paid parental leave, but also that decades of data show that employers do not offer paid leave unless pushed to by government.
docs.snippet: The G.O.P. should help all parents, not just its own.

docs.lead_paragraph: A couple find that a relationship is like making custard: “If you cook it too fast, you end up with scrambled eggs.”

headline.main: Meeting Each Other Halfway, and Then Some
headline.sub: A couple find that a relationship is like making custard: "If you cook it too fast, you end up with scrambled eggs."
headline.print_headline: Meeting Each Other Halfway, and Then Some

docs.abstract: Vows column on wedding of Lori Levine and Jan van Arsdale.
docs.snippet: A couple find that a relationship is like making custard: “If you cook it too fast, you end up with scrambled eggs.”

docs.lead_paragraph: The American movie mainstream needs a revolution — and if some women have their way, it just might get one.

headline.seo: On Many Fronts, Women Are Fighting for Better Opportunity in Hollywood

docs.abstract: Women are extremely underrepresented in Hollywood, both on screen and behind camera; major film studios are force behind institutional discrimination, especially against female directors; growing number of people and organizations in movie industry are working to rectify imbalance.
docs.snippet: The American movie mainstream needs a revolution — and if some women have their way, it just might get one.

docs.lead_paragraph: So much for the House passing that bill banning abortions after 20 weeks. Didn’t work out as planned.
docs.abstract: Gail Collins Op-Ed column observes that collapse of Pain-Capable Unborn Child Protection Act, which bans abortions after 20 weeks, has come as disappointment to Republicans on anniversary of Roe v Wade; notes that bill was undermined by spat over rape exemption; holds that such debates have come to exasperate more moderate Republicans.
docs.snippet: So much for the House passing that bill banning abortions after 20 weeks. Didn’t work out as planned.

docs.lead_paragraph: Authorities are investigating two murders that happened in the shadows beyond the bright lights surrounding Times Square in New York City.

headline.main: Amid Times Square’s Bright Lights, Murders in the Shadows
headline.print_headline: Amid Times Square’s Bright Lights, Murders in the Shadows

docs.abstract: Michael Wilson Crime Scene column notes that Times Square's homicide-free 2014 is quickly dispatched in early weeks of 2015, with area logging two brutal murders within days of each other.
docs.snippet: Authorities are investigating two murders that happened in the shadows beyond the bright lights surrounding Times Square in New York City.
